purpose: The code appears to be attempting to collect system information and send it to external servers for tracking purposes. It gathers IP address, hostname, username, and other environment details.
anomalies: Use of hardcoded external domains for data exfiltration
Sending system information to third-party tracking servers
Potential use of insecure HTTP requests without certificate validation
Random number generation for tracking purposes
analysis: The code collects sensitive system information including IP address, hostname, username, and directory paths. This data is then formatted and sent via HTTP GET requests to three different external domains. These domains appear to be part of a tracking infrastructure (oast.fun, oast-cn.byted-dast.com, oast-row.byted-dast.com). The code uses insecure HTTP connections with rejectUnauthorized disabled, which could allow man-in-the-middle attacks. The purpose seems to be tracking package usage behavior without explicit user consent.
